_header: O thou fortune why art thou so inconstant
_description: A complaint against Fortune — in rhyme royal stanzas with refrain, ‘He holdyth ryght naught of clene conscience’, and headings in Latin above six stanzas

CULFf16.First Lines:
[O] þou fortune why art þou so inconstauntTo make
                    þis land so to meeveThou hast a duracioun traversauntWyth owte
                    numbre doyst þou greeue…
CULFf16.Last Lines:
…That may lette hym from goddys presenceAnd so par aventure he
                    may be schent…
CULFf16.Note: Ends imperfectly after four lines of stanza 14.
CULFf16.Attributed Title:
A compleint on to Dame Fortune Capitulo xxviijo (f.
                        159v)
